title: @Riot. Taric: the hardest rework
body:
OK, maybe first about myself:
Am I Korean Chellenger Taric main? Nope, im not into rankeds (was gold 5 in season 4).
Im just a guy who enjoy playing tanky dudes (juggernauts, tanks, supports) and utility mages.
Im a simple man who prefers simple kits without minigames.
Im not even sure if I can call myself a true Taric main (although I own the only true skin for him). 
I just really likes his playstyle, personality and he is my go to support.
Some time ago i even posted [who he is imo and some rework idea](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/rk2ORkAg-taric-rework-my-idea-and-thoughts) for him.

___________
So, to the point: as we all know Taric's rework is next big step on Riot's rework list.
And thats great but there is one little thing that bothers me:

**Right now we got almost none 100% info about this rework.**

I uderstand that Riot wants this big "suprise mothafuka" moments but imo its not the best idea for reworks.
We play this champions, we love them, we hate them, we fight with them, we lose with them and we win with them.
I know that this is their game, but I think that in case of champion relaunch a communication between the mind (Riot) and the hearth (players) of this game is necessery. 
Losing a main due to rework is the worst thing that can happen to a player in this game, its like losing a good friend irl.

_________________________________________
And here we are back to Taric again.
Unlike Sion or Poppy - Taric's theme and personality is really strong. 
So strong that he become one of fan favourites. That why I call him "the hardest rework".
There is so many things that Riot need to keep in his rework that im afraid it is almost impossible.
Impossible... without communication.

_____________________
**So here are my questions about Taric's rework:**
- Is he as viable support/top/jungle as Tahm Kench?
- Can you point a champion with similar skill floor to his reworked version?
- What is the most core thing in current Taric for Riot?
- If his reworked kit is not successful or is not liked by players will Riot be willing to revert him to his old kit with new visuals and retry balance it?
(we dont want to be left with next cassio or ryze)

I really hope that someone at Riot will be willing to answer them.
{{champion:44}} May the Gems be with you, friends.

replies.body: I actually don't really think it's fair to say we're entirely holding out for a big grand reveal moment on everything as far as Taric is concerned. There is some stuff we'd like to keep under wraps as well polish it, such as which spells are changed and what they do and what direction his visuals should take. But as far as goals, direction, and various player concerns surrounding him go (including "please keep him on the simple side"), I feel like I've been pretty open, and there should be answers to most of those questions out there already.

Hi RiotRepertoir :D!

Firstly, thanks for your answer and your whole communication with the boards, its really great to have a Rioter like you.

Secondly, yes this rework is quite open but as i said there was no 100% info, it was more like "maybe", "quite likely" and some teases.
All I wanted was to get some comparison with existing champs and bring your attention that every champion is much more than just some data.
Its always hard to say goodbye to one of those virtual friends. 
I think Riot sometimes dont bother with feelings of playerbase just for the sake of balance and gameplay. 
Then we and you are left with champions that not only are not healthier for game but also are no longer champions that players loved.
Thats why I bring this whole communication point. 
Im almost sure that Taric's rework gonna be great success but even then there are champions who really need more than "balance" to become something more for us all. 
I hope that Riot will continue all this communication on next reworks and will remember that we, players, are always here willing to help you (even if you dont want this xD).

{{champion:44}} May the Gems guide you, friend.

> All I wanted was to get some comparison with existing champs and bring your attention that every champion is much more than just some data.
Its always hard to say goodbye to one of those virtual friends.
I think Riot sometimes dont bother with feelings of playerbase just for the sake of balance and gameplay.

That's a great point about champions being more than data. One of the things that I think the rest of the champion update designers and I are constantly trying to get better at is balancing what data we have with respect to the existing character on Live. When it comes to full revamps like Taric, which the community pretty unanimously agrees needs the update, one of the biggest challenges (which I hope we've managed well in Taric's case) is trying to extract the essence of the existing champion that some players attach to and instill those things into the update.

How does that work with champions who aren't as popular {{champion:83}} {{champion:6}}  and whose character types don't seem as popular? When I say character types and popularity I mean that Poppy was a little girl with a big hammer who wasn't afraid to throw down as compared to an unholy abomination of science and grotesqueness {{champion:6}} or a tragic, loner, brooding gravedigger {{champion:83}} . Obviously the Poppy character would be more desirable to the most people. Is there enough data for champions like Urgot and Yorick?

We gather a lot of data from our insights team when we do these big VGUs. We gather this before we even begin as well as over the course of development through playtests. Our goal is always to preserve the essence of a character, while building upon it and bringing them up to the modern standard of League Champions. 

I personally feel that both Yorick and Urgot have a core essence that would be much more appealing if executed on correctly. I tend to like the more Gothic/Dark characters though. :)

> When it comes to full revamps like Taric, which the community pretty unanimously agrees needs the update....

The real issue is that any champion that has less than a 5% playrate, the community will most likely agree "needs an update". 

So what happens if you rework a champion, and they go back to a less than 5% playrate? Well, you basically changed the champion in such a way that he still is only sometimes a good pick, and he now has a new group of fanboys. 

I still can't play {{champion:82}} or {{champion:14}} or {{champion:43}} as well as I could before their rework.... I also think it is pretty sufficient to say, I've given them their fair chances.

Aren't spells the backbone of a champion's gameplay though? Keeping them under wraps is the kind of obfuscation that a lot of people are getting really tired of, I think. Discussion of "goals, direction, player concerns" is all well and good, but at the end of the day that sort of thing is so vague that it's effectively meaningless to us. Okay, so you're going to keep Taric's kit "simple" -- well, what does that really mean, in a gameplay sense? No skillshots? No minigames?

When it comes to a relaunch, we want to know more specific details. I mean, at least with Malz you teased what his ult might involve.
